Home
>
ABOUT US
ABOUT US
IMPORTANT TO NOTE
The St Lucie County Fair
is NOT
a part of St Lucie County or State of Florida government and thus receives no tax dollars or other subsidies.
We are a private 501c3 non-profit organization dedicated to enriching our community by promoting education and local agriculture while showcasing and rewarding youth achievement.   We accomplish this by producing a first-class 10-day Fair each Spring with quality family entertainment, Agricultural education, and recognition of youth programs in Art, Music, Horticulture and Agriculture.  More than 90% of funds raised at this event stay local and bolster our local economy.
of
Transcript
PRIVACY NOTICE
PRIVACY NOTICE
We provide personal experiences educating the public in agriculture, horticulture, creative arts and crafts, sciences and civics, while providing quality entertainment for the people of the Treasure Coast.
The St Lucie County Fair Association operates and manages the LARGEST EVENT on the Treasure Coast and serves the residents of St. Lucie, Martin, Indian River and Okeechobee Counties.
Our Goal is:
To be Financially self-sustainable.
To be a "Good" Neighbor in the community.
A state of the art facility to bring various shows and expositions to the Treasure Coast.
A facility to offer to the general public for personal use.
To help develop the fairgrounds to a year-round facility.
To assist in marketing to attract new entertainment based business to the area.
The St Lucie County Fair Association is a private 501c(3), non profit organization dedicated to enriching our community by promoting education and Florida agriculture while showcasing and rewarding youth achievement. We accomplish this by producing a first-class yearly ten day Fair with quality family entertainment and a lot of dedicated volunteers. Over the years we have supported other non-profits and charities throughout our community. We look forward to partnering with you to make our community stronger and better.

Community Partner Events
Community Partner Events
Country Christmas Parade - Sunday, December 3rd
Please come watch us in the 35th Annual Sights & Sounds Main Street Christmas Parade on Sunday, December 3rd, from 1pm until 6pm on Second Street, Fort Pierce.  This years theme is "Under The Sea".   For more information contact MainStreet@MainStreetFortPierce.org
